post.body: What? You just got married? Congratulations. Can't wait to hear more.
@ChathleenRitt - Please don't ReTweet this and start a 'meme' about how @samharrelson hates the terms retweeting and meme.
- Your algorithm loved me more than your new editor does.
- Thanks for your Christmas Music that doesn't Suck Pandora playlist. http://urlzen.com/3kb
That 'Google Gears Down' headline confused me - http://urlzen.com/3jr
Another way Twitter is like a single malt scotch is that it can be addictive once you acquire the taste.
I also am told "You don't sound like you grew up in Ala." and likewise, I don't know if it's a compliment or insult.
- I hear the Cowboy's have reinstated your favorite player. http://urlzen.com/3jm
I think you should change the "N" to a "B" and you'll be OK.
I'm a fan of Firefox, but I'm sharing your pain. It's gotten slower and sloooower. And the beachball is getting tiresome.
I've decided that this year, we need all the holiday season we can get. Typically, I'm tuning it out until about Dec 23.
has added to my cheerful day by pointing to a DIY barf bag iphone holder for watching inflight flix http://tinyurl.com/5wo2bd
- I guess I violated some SEC 'insider cheerfulness' regulations.
- Yes. It will be hard for me to Police everything people say wrong on the Internet -- and still be my new 100% cheerful self.
Oh yeah! BTW, I follow you on both your accounts. On the other one, you're not smiling, but you're funny. ( @jonhenshaw )
Thanks Mike. You know me so well.
I am glad you noticed my blogs' timeout issues. I noticed it too. I'm replacing our algorithims with a baseball bat today.
Can you point to an example or explanation of Times Extra. Sounds like a great example of some 'link journalism'
Leipers Creek Rd & Old Hillsboro Rd http://loopt.us/Z1zCsA
Your dust-bowl holiday avatar is depressingly cheerful.
You win the cheerful avatar of the day award. Congratulations.
Vanderbilt® is playing in the Gaylord Hotels® Music City Bowl® - http://www.musiccitybowl.com/
OK. You asked for a 12-1 Titans victory badge. Here it is - http://urlzen.com/3nq
- Ironic, then. Pacman can help the Titans move towards securing playoff homefield advantage by helping the Cowboys beat Steelers.
- I find myself in the unique position of cheering for your Dallas Cowboys. Is Pacman playing?
' come thru with a holiday euphamism - 'Unpaid Christmas Vacation' - Sounds downright Dickensian.
sez 'workplace virtualization' a euphemism for going from full-time to 'virtual' workforce. Some MBAs worked overtime on that one
- ouch 'surplussing' seems painful also. @davidhhendricks 'flatening' turns a cake into a pancake. In the UK, 'redundancy' works
is pointing to Michael Hyatt 's decision to go on a media fast. (I'll add that to my 'happy' efforts) http://ping.fm/sKxRD
Are you competing? ; )
Thnx for RTing my request for people to join the Friend Connect thing on http://SmallBusiness.com. OK - I'll stop the pleading.
- thanks for the whole answer in <140 characters.
@BeckyMcCray, @rex, @unclespeedo - Thanks all for your help. See @rex 's tweet.
just passed the 10K tweet-mark.15K more and he'll catch up w/ @chrisbrogan ( http://urlzen.com/3ra )
I can just hear people saying, OMG, you're just encouraging him. (P.S. I'm only funny at <140 characters.)
I think old fogies like that suck.
I nominate @smallbusiness for a Shorty Award in #business because he keeps me on my toes and points me to all the good stuff.
predicts DC charities will get a windfall of shoes from the White House when shoes start showing up there http://tinyurl.com/66dt6j
- I will respond to a comment by you in a moment, but don't want to jinx the game at this point. #Titans
's 2008 T-theme is Passion Creates Community - Share Your Passion here - thttp://urlzen.com/41u How/about: http://urlzen.com/41
- She attends the University of St Andrews in Scotland so her trip started out many hours ago in Edinburgh.
Come to think of it, I think I saw #Clawback perform at South by Southwest a couple years ago. ; )
- The Newark airport is good in this case, as there's an Amtrak station connected via the tram. i.e., easy to escape it.
- You must have offended lots of people / that or the fact that Twitter is purging lots of deleted accounts - see @twitter.
Retwitting this from @samharrelson - "retweeting"has replaced "memes" as the douchebaggiest descriptor/action in the geek lexicon. ; )
I typically eschew 'sounds of the season' music until Xmas eve. This year, I'm already going 24/7 to encourage lots of cheer.
My 2¢ blog post about @gaberivers 's blog post - " @Techmeme ’s algorithm now ‘officially’ includes an elf" - http://is.gd/a7zI
However, I do think my tweets have a southern accent.
Here are Apple's 'basics of Mac' videos - http://www.apple.com/findouthow/mac/
What's a good online resource (turoial?) for helping a Windows user who is about to have a Mac for the first time. (Not for me, of course.)
#Humor - Borowitz Report - "China buying U.S. naming rights for $1.4 trillion." Renaming it "Panda Garden" - http://is.gd/9UXw
The stock market tanked today because investors heard there is a recession. What rock have these morons been hiding under?
Used to hate Christmas music but this year, I'm already listening (thnx to @gapingvoid and @kevinmarks) to - http://snurl.com/70dwi
The stock market was down until I started tweeting cheefully. That should convince doubters. @KariRippetoe - R Downey Jr is a gr8 pianst too
Most people who try to be funny-angry come off just angry. However, Merlin Mann ( hotdogsladies ) is a master of the art: http://is.gd/akry
I promise to attempt to tweet more cheerfully in the future. Although I've been informed I'm more entertaining when I'm ranting.
The song "Smile" was written by Charlie Chaplin. Most intriguing (depressing?) cover (to me) of it is by Robert Downey Jr. http://is.gd/amKH
Y'all better start smiling or nobody will want to follow you on Twitter. (NPR Morning Edition Story - http://is.gd/al8S )
my friend Lewis has the world's plainest website, http://Lewis.net. He added google/friendconnect to it today as a joke. I just joined.
NYTimes.com - A study of Facebook avatars finds that users w/ smailing avatars are 'friended' by more than non-smilers. http://is.gd/aiu2
RT @brianstelter: Times Extra has debuted on http://nytimes.com/ -- a service adds links to competing news stories and blogs. - Kudos
Very important breaking news - Reporter who said Obama has Zune admits he could have been wrong - http://is.gd/acx1
I'm considering using a baseball bat to address a server problem. Fortunately, the server is in another city.
Blog post: If spammers created my Christmas gift-giving list - http://urlzen.com/3mx
Blog post - Why the government should bailout Google - http://urlzen.com/3ms
Y'all can thank me and my new happy tweeting for today's robust stock market rally. Next week, I'm going to happy talk the Recession away.
Google alert just let me know 'rex hammock' was mentioned in a post about a ferret named rex who sleeps in a hammock - http://is.gd/aJky
Things I've learned from UAW protestors - 1. That Bob Corker has an office in this building. 2. There is no 2. http://urlzen.com/3o0
Usually I put weather photos in this set of shots from my office window. Today I just added photos of UAW protestors - http://urlzen.com/3o0
Vanderbilt 'traveling' to its first bowl game since 1982 - Here are Google map directions (walking). http://is.gd/aDO3
At the titans game. So cold I can't feel toes. http://twitpic.com/qzkv
I pride myself on effective in-box management. Therefore I'm not very proud right now.
Just gmail video-chatted w/ my daughter in Scotland. So far, it has been less glitchy than iChat video.
I think the term one should use to describe the opposite of "an economic depression" should be "an economic happy."
I've heard 'reduction in force' 'restructuring' 'reorg' and an array of other euphemisms for layoffs. But 'delayering'? Hadn't heard that.
I conducted previous research on whether giving away money makes me happy. Doesn't. At least, not if AIG, Citi et al are the recipients.
I'm considering seeking a $10 million grant to research if $10 million can make me happy. I figure the grant will at least get me started.
Favor request time. I've added Google's Friend Connect to http://SmallBusiness.com and need some 'joiners.' Nice way to promote your face.
I'm thinking of playing @jaxn 's pandora playlist via my iPhone's speaker from shirt pocket - spreading cheer. http://urlzen.com/3rf
I'm being made cheerful by @jaxn 's Pandora playlist of Christmas music that doesn't suck. http://urlzen.com/3rf
A geeky Twitter question from a non-geek. Is there a way to generate an RSS feed of tweets I "star as "favorite"
Pain in the neck to cause pain in the ass to miss rest of season. (Pacman Jones update) http://snurl.com/7r1z7
Gee, I see that @hammockinc has started tweeting. He (actually, in this case, she - @SummerH ) needs some followers.
Just saw a commercial offering a U.S. Senate seat reprenting Ill. for only three monthly payments of $350,000. Think I'll order one.
I just got invited to connect w/ someone on Yahoo! Sorry, I'm over-connected.
That previous tweet was complete drivel designed to promote @smallbusiness . Not like all my other drivel here designed to do nothing.
I think Titans will need to beat Steelers twice to get to Superbowl. If they lose Sun., it will mean having to win in PItt in Jan. Not good
Oh well. The Titans are going to have to gain homefield advantage the old fashioned way. By beating the Steelers next Sunday.
I don't believe http://tweetwasters.com - Who spends 30 seconds writing a tweet? Not me. Isn't that obvious?
This Ravens-Steelers game is making me more nervous than the Titans game did. I think there's a good chance it will go into OT.
Evernote users -- Any suggestion for an online resource to get an Evernote newbie (me) up to speed the fastest?
Shoe throwing has inspired puns from @bruingeek @davidhhendricks Shoe droped, Thrower had no sole. Socked it to him. Gave Bush the boot.
I still think Bush's head-fake shoe dodge will long be remembered as 1 of his most adroit moves and one of the highlights of his presidency
I 'multi-tasked' this blog post about defunct auto manufacturers while watching the Titans game - http://is.gd/bFej
Heading outside to play Dodge Shoe with the kids next door.
And despite what the CBS announcers said many times, next week's Steelers-Titans game is in Nashville, not Pittsburg. I'll be there yelling.
This means the Titans - Steelers game next week will likely be a 'playoff' game for who gets homefield advantage thru the AFC playoffs.
This makes Steelers Titans game next week a contest for who gets home field advantage thru the AFC playoffs. Should be a great game.
Albert Haynesworth gets hurt 2-3 times every game. Not to worry.
In my 10 years of watching the Titans, that was the most incredibly un-Jeff Fisher play call. No other play even come close.
My nomination for the worst CBS crew are the idiots calling the Titans-Texans game. They can't even read an team schedule.
Titans 9 Texans 10 - This is formulaic Titans game. Grind away. Wear them down. Bore the opponents into turnovers. It's why they're 12-1.
Las Vegas has #Titans +2 underdog. I think that's about right. My controversial suggestion: Start Vince Young. Chances it will happen: None.
I think #Titans can beat the #Steelers, I just don't think they can today. 2 injured pro-bowlers and a slumping QB make Titans my underdog.
Heading later to one of the most strange #Titans games ever. The team is 12-2 but nobody thinks they'll win including, most strangely, me.
Weird & Weirder - Rod Blagojevich has a Nashville brother named Rob who took part in 30 of the now infamous ph. calls http://is.gd/cChH
Thanks @markalves @dougpetch @b2btw, Lionel Valdellon for sharing your passion on http://PassionCreatesCommunity.com
Here's a photo of the Hammock T-shirt you can win from @hammockinc (Megan P not included.) http://urlzen.com/41n
It seems @hammockinc is giving away one of our cool T-shirts to someone who 'shares a passion' by 6 p.m. eastern. Odds are high you'll win.
The nightmare that just refuses to go away. Pacman Jones' neck heals miraculously http://is.gd/czly Congrats, @ColeH
Heading home from college a bit challenging for my daughter today as she's stuck at Newark airport. I'm now playing travel agent.
For the word not to be in Wikipedia, #clawback s are now everywhere - http://urlzen.com/41m
Prediciton - #Clawback will be the 2009 word of the year. For the record: It's not now in wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clawback
ORD in Chicago, IL http://loopt.us/Xvhu6g
in Chicago, IL http://loopt.us/tO5vCg
I'm in denial that in the morning, I'm supposed to be at the airport for a 6 am flt to Chicago.
Who are those people with the one-letterTwitter user names? (I heard they're all members of the Trilaterial commission.) http://is.gd/cg6C
